casebody.data:
The National Oleo Meter Co., Appellant v. Walter M. Jackson, Respondent. Decided January 7, 1889. Appeal by plaintiff from a judgment entered after a trial at special term, dismissing the complaint. Edmund Coffin, Jr., for appellant. Isaac Angel, for respondent.

Before Sedgwick, Ch. J., and Truax, J.

The appeal involved substantially only questions of fact. The Court held (Per Curiam), “ that the judgment should be affirmed.”
